content.p: Associate Professor, Prior to her joining the University of Nottingham Malaysia Campus as an assistant professor, Wan Yong pursued her PhD studies in Universiti Putra Malaysia, where she also received her first degree in Biotechnology. She worked on the discovery of cytotoxic effect of herbal extract against breast cancer cells for her PhD and has initiated the study of herb-drug interaction against 3D spheroid cultures of breast cancer therefrom. At UNMC, apart from continuing the exploration of antineoplastic potential of various natural products, she extended her research focus in understanding the regulation of genes and microRNAs in breast cancer stem cells. Wan Yong is an enthusiastic teacher who loves to share her knowledge and experience with students. She is teaching topics in the areas of cancer and molecular biology where her research is focused… read more Wan Yong's primary research interest resides in cancer stem cell (CSC) regulation in breast cancer cell lines.
